page.title: 11Finance Dalgety Bay.
page.content: In the commercial centre there is a bank and a building society. The bank is a branch of the Royal Bank of Scotland. It is only a temporary construction - a portacabin type grey hut. It may not be very attractive from the outside but it does good business because it is the only bank in the town. The branch is small and only caters for clients wishing to deposit and withdraw money. It does not deal with foreign currency transactions. For that service customers have to go to the larger branches in Dunfermline, Kirkcaldy or Edinburgh. The building society is a branch of the Halifax which has in the last few years lost a number of accounts to a rival society in the new shopping centre to the west.
